import React from 'react' import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag' import Logo from './Logo.js' import logoSvg from './logo.svg'; export default ({components, ...props}) => {`Introduction`}

React Scroll Section

A declarative solution to vertically navigate your React App

{`Why you should use it? 🤔`} {`When you think about implementing a `}{`scrollTo`}{` functionality in a website the first thing it will your mind will be jQuery, using the following line of code: `} {` \$( "#target" ).scroll(); `} {`I won't deny that actually works, but the problem comes when you start working with frameworks based on component, like React.`} {`Manage the navigation to another section and which section can be hard task without a state management library.`} {`This library will help you to avoid thinking all the possible edges cases and focus on the final result, which is just provide an easy navigation inside your app.`} {`Basic Example ✅`} {`Basically, the library provides you 3 components:`} {`ScrollingProvider: responsible to move between the Sections and know which Section is selected. `} {`SectionLink: giving a Section ID will perform the navigation after clicking on it.`} {`Section: just a `}{`
`}{` that receives an ID and register it on ScrollingProvider.`} {`Built with 🔧`} {`Just react! Using the features of:`} {`Context API: Consumer and Provider pattern`} {`Ref: new `}{`createRef`}{` API!`} {`License 🔖`} {`MIT.`} {`Contribute ❤️`} {`I'm super open to PRs! Could be improvement of performance, small changes in API, more documentation whatever you want 😁`}
